Name.BusinessNameLine1: ROEPER CITY AND COUNTRY SCHOOL INC

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: PROVIDE EDUCATION FOR GIFTED STUDENTS OF DIVERSE BACKGROUNDS IN PRE-K THROUGH 12TH GRADE.
IRS990.MissionDescription: PROVIDE EDUCATION FOR GIFTED STUDENTS OF DIVERSE BACKGROUNDS IN PRE K THROUGH 12TH GRADE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE ROEPER PHILOSOPHY OF RESPECT AND RESPONSIBILITY, WITH TEACHERS WHO UNDERSTAND THEIR PROFESSION AND THE CHARACTERISTICS OF GIFTED CHILDREN AND IN A SAFE ENVIRONMENT FOR INTELLECTUAL, SOCIAL, EMOTIONAL AND PHYSICAL GROWTH.
IRS990.Description: PROVIDE AN INDIVIDUALIZED EDUCATION FOR PRE K THROUGH SECONDARY STUDENTS THAT IS APPROPRIATE TO THE INTELLECTUAL, EMOTIONAL AND PHYSICAL NEEDS OF GIFTED AND CREATIVE CHILDREN IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE ROEPER PHILOSOPHY AND SYSTEM OF VALUES.

Activity2.Description: PROVIDE A LEARNING ENVIRONMENT THROUGH EXTRA-CURRICULAR ACTIVITIES AND AFTER-CARE PROGRAMS FOR PRE K THROUGH SECONDARY STUDENTS THAT IS APPROPRIATE TO THE INTELLECTUAL, EMOTIONAL AND PHYSICAL NEEDS OF GIFTED AND CREATIVE CHILDREN IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE ROEPER PHILOSOPHY AND SYSTEM OF VALUES.

Activity3.Description: PROVIDE RECREATIONAL SUMMER DAY CAMP AND ENRICHMENT FOR SCHOOL AGE CHILDREN IN THE DETROIT METROPOLITAN AREA IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE ROEPER PHILOSOPHY AND SYSTEM OF VALUES.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE USED PRIMARILY FOR SCHOLARSHIPS.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The School has evaluated the provisions of ASC Topic 740, Accounting for Uncertainty in Income Taxes. The evaluation was performed for the tax years 2006 through 2009, the years which remain subject to examination by major tax jurisdiction as of June 30, 2010. The School concluded that there are no significant uncertain tax positions requiring recognition in the School's financial statements. The School does not expect the total amount of unrecognized tax benefits ("UTB") (e.g. tax deductions, exclusions, or credits claimed or expected to be claimed) to significantly change in the next twelve months. The School does not have any amounts accrued for interest and penalties related to UTBs at June 30, 2010, and it is not aware of any claims for such amounts by federal or state income tax authorities.
GRANTS AND ALLOCATIONS - FINANCIAL AID & SCHOLARSHIPS: 1634380.
GRANTS AND ALLOCATIONS - FINANCIAL AID & SCHOLARSHIPS: 1634380.

Form990ScheduleIPartIII.TypeOfGrant: FINANCIAL AID AND SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS ATTENDING THE ROEPER SCHOOL

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: THE ROEPER SCHOOL GRANTS FINANCIAL AID TO ITS STUDENTS BASED UPON FINANCIAL NEED. FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE IS AWARDED ON A YEARLY BASIS AND FAMILIES MUST FILE A PARENTS' FINANCIAL STATEMENT EVERY YEAR THEY DESIRE ASSISTANCE. STUDENTS APPLYING FOR THIRD-PARTY SCHOLARSHIPS OR FINANCIAL AID MUST COMPLETE THE SCHOOL'S ENROLLMENT PROCESS. IN ADDITION, THIRD-PARTY SCHOLARSHIP APPLICANTS MUST MEET THE CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY THE FOUNDATIONS FUNDING THE SCHOLARSHIPS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ROEPER SCHOOL UPDATED AND ADOPTED THE POLICY FOR TRUSTEES CONCERNING FIDUCIARY RESPONSIBILITY AND CONFLICTS OF INTEREST ("POLICY") IN SEPTEMBER 2002 WHICH ADDRESSES BOTH GENERAL AND FINANCIAL CONFLICTS. THE POLICY IS REVIEWED IN DEPTH WITH ALL NEW TRUSTEES DURING A TRUSTEE ORIENTATION AND THERE IS A CALL FOR CONFLICTS AT THE BEGINNING OF EACH BOARD MEETING. IN ADDITION, THE SCHOOL ALLOCATES TIME AT ITS SEPTEMBER BOARD MEETING FOR ALL TRUSTEES TO COMPLETE A WRITTEN CONFLICT OF INTEREST ANNUAL CERTIFICATION. THOSE CONFLICTS OR POTENTIAL CONFLICTS THAT ARE DISCLOSED OR DISCOVERED ARE REVIEWED BY THE AD HOC CONFLICTS COMMITTEE ("COMMITTEE"), COMPRISED OF THREE BOARD MEMBERS AND THE SCHOOL ATTORNEY, AND A RECOMMENDATION IS MADE TO THE CHAIR OF THE BOARD, IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE POLICY. SUCH RECOMMENDATION MAY INCLUDE A FINDING OF NO CONFLICT OR A CONFLICT WITH FURTHER RECOMMENDATIONS ON MATERIALITY, DISCLOSURE, RECUSAL FROM DISCUSSIONS AND/OR VOTING, OR ALTERNATIVES THAT WOULD NOT GIVE RISE TO A CONFLICT. THE COMMITTEE SHALL KEEP MINUTES ON ITS DETERMINATIONS AND, IN THE EVENT OF DISCLOSURE TO THE BOARD, THE BOARD SHALL RECORD MINUTES ON THE MATTER AS WELL.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES DESIGNATED THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE (OR NO FEWER THAN THREE DESIGNATED MEMBERS THEREOF) TO NEGOTIATE AND ENTER INTO A CONTRACT WITH THE HEAD OF THE SCHOOL. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SELECTED THREE MEMBERS TO FORM A HEAD COMPENSATION COMMITTEE AND ALL INDIVIDUALS CERTIFIED THEY HAD NO CONFLICT OF INTEREST. THE COMMITTEE UTILIZED INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS BENCHMARKING DATA TO ASSIST IN DETERMINING THE COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS PACKAGE. ALSO, THE COMMITTEE DOCUMENTED THE DECISION REGARDING THE FINAL COMPENSATION ARRANGEMENT.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: these documents are available upon request.
THE PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.

Form990ScheduleRPartII.PrimaryActivities: RESEARCH ON AND DISSEMINATION OF GIFTED EDUCATION INFORMATION
